title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 April 2015 - XWiki
content:

10:53 <spawn57\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:55 <spawn57\_> Hi, I've added an object to a page in XWiki, but I don't want to display the form and all it's fields on the wiki page.  Is there anyway of hiding the fields?  
10:59 <lucaa> has quit

14:08 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <Chuguniy> has quit  
14:39 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
14:43 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:53 <vmassol> has quit  
14:54 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:57 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:34 <Slashman> tmortagne: XE-1478 is still not fixed, it doesn't work on Debian with (at least) postgres 9.3  
15:35 <Slashman> I just updated a wiki with the new xwiki version "7.0+1" and the issue was the same as last time  
15:36 <tmortagne> Slashman: could you look at /usr/lib/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib  
15:36 <tmortagne> you should have a link to the pgsql driver there  
15:36 <tmortagne> which one do you have ?  
15:37 <Slashman> tmortagne: it's /usr/share/java/postgresql-jdbc4.jar, that's not the issue  
15:37 <tmortagne> that's the change I made  
15:38 <tmortagne> /usr/share/java/postgresql-jdbc4.jar is supposed to work well with postgre  
15:38 <Slashman> the issue is that postgresql-jdbc4.jar -> postgresql-jdbc4-9.1.jar and postgresql-jdbc4-9.1.jar doesn't work  
15:38 <tmortagne> Slashman: on your system  
15:38 <tmortagne> on mide it's 9.2  
15:38 <tmortagne> probablem is there is not much more I can do at this package level  
15:39 <tmortagne> s/probablem/problem/  
15:39 <tmortagne> s/mide/mine/  
15:39 <tmortagne> since I got report that it was working well with postgresql-jdbc4-9.2.jar I change the package to at least force using the jdbc4 one  
15:39 <Slashman> I guess postgresql-jdbc4-9.1.jar on Debian is "https://jdbc.postgresql.org/download/postgresql-9.1-903.jdbc3.jar", which is JDBC 3  
15:40 <tmortagne> that would not make much sense that postgresql-jdbc4 point to a jdbc4 driver  
15:40 <Slashman> hm... right  
15:41 <Slashman> I don't know then, do you want the error message and an other ticket when I try to start with postgresql-jdbc4-9.1.jar?  
15:41 <tmortagne> sure, also indicate your system exactly so that we know exactly where it does not work  
15:41 <tmortagne> I guess the workaround is to upgrade your driver some way  
15:42 <Slashman> the workaround is not an issue, I've done it, it's just for other people :p  
15:43 <tmortagne> maybe there is simply some bug in that driver version...  
15:44 <Slashman> looking at the patch note https://jdbc.postgresql.org/documentation/changelog.html ...  
15:49 <vmassol> has quit  
15:51 <DarkKnightCZ> r  
15:51 <DarkKnightCZ> (typo)  
15:58 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
16:01 <tmortagne> msmeria: did you tried 7.0 with postgre recently ?  
16:02 <tmortagne> I would like to know which version of the driver you could make it work with if you did  
16:23 <msmeria> tmortagne: hello. no, I haven't tested 7.0 on Postgres  
16:23 <msmeria> I'll test now with the latest driver available  
16:24 <tmortagne> msmeria: actually what I would like to know is the minimum version for the potgresql and mysql drivers  
16:24 <tmortagne> the idea being to indicate this in the debian package  
16:24 <tmortagne> I think you tested several for mysql already  
16:24 <vmassol> msmeria: would be great to verify that XWiki doesn't work with the latest mysql drivers...  
16:24 <vmassol> as reported on the list  
16:24 <vmassol> :)  
16:24 <vmassol> 5.1.35 from memory  
16:26 <msmeria> vmassol: I already tested that and replied to that email. check it again :)  
16:26 <vmassol> cool  
16:26 <vmassol> thanks  
16:26 <vmassol> (Im lagging behind on my emails)  
16:27 <msmeria> no problem  
16:27 <msmeria> it's your birthday. I forgive you :D  
16:28 <vmassol> hehe thanks :)  
16:28 <msmeria> tmortagne: yes, I've tested some versions of the driver, but I didn't note down the version since they worked  
16:28 <vmassol> I'm lucky!  
16:28 <msmeria> if the would fail, I would have reported an issue  
16:29 <msmeria> they\*  
16:29 <msmeria> tmortagne: what driver versions do you want me to test ?  
16:30 <tmortagne> for mysql no idea, I guess the first one claiming jdbc4 support  
16:30 <tmortagne> for postgre it looks like there is an issue with the 9.1 one and it seems to work well with the 9.2-1002 one  
16:30 <tmortagne> but there is several version between thos two  
16:31 <tmortagne> see XE-1478  
16:31 <tmortagne> what would be nice is confirm issue with 9.1 and test version after this one to find the first one that works with XWiki  
16:33 <msmeria> tmortagne: as I can see here: https://jdbc.postgresql.org/download.html there are 2 versions of 9.1: 1 that is jdbc3 compatible and one that is jdbc4 compatible. you want me to test the jdbc4 one, right ?  
16:34 <tmortagne> msmeria: I'm only talking about jdbc4 drivers  
16:34 <msmeria> ok. thanks  
16:35 <tmortagne> note that what is on  https://jdbc.postgresql.org/download.html are the supported version but they actually released more version than that  
16:35 <tmortagne> see https://jdbc.postgresql.org/documentation/changelog.html  
16:36 <tmortagne> not sure which one exactly Slashman has issue with  
16:37 <tmortagne> Slashman: would to check the exact version of the 9.1 driver you have with apt-cache show for example  
16:39 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:39 <Slashman> the version installed is 9.1-901-2  
16:39 <tmortagne> ok thanks  
16:41 <Slashman> my guess is that this version works fine with postgres 9.1 which is in the wheezy repository  
16:41 <Slashman> I may hit a corner case because we use recent version of postgres  
16:41 <tmortagne> from what I see the last 9.1 version is the 903, maybe some bug has been fixed in it  
16:42 <vmassol> has quit  
16:42 <tmortagne> or yes maybe 9.1 simply does not like too much postgre 9.3  
16:43 <Slashman> well, postgres 9.1 was released in 2011  
16:43 <Slashman> so that may be the problem  
16:43 <tmortagne> yea debian stable does not exactly contains most recent stuff :)  
16:46 <Slashman> indeed... maybe a warning somewhere for users if they use debian with a more recent postgres version? will have to test first with postgres 9.1 to validate my theory  
16:47 <msmeria> tmortagne: I can't seem to find the 9.1-901-2 jdbc driver  
16:47 <Slashman> tmortagne: or you could integrate the jdbc into the xwiki repo  
16:47 <tmortagne> msmeria: 901  
16:47 <tmortagne> 901-2 is debian package version  
16:48 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
16:48 <msmeria> there's only 903 on the download page  
16:48 <tmortagne> Slashman: we could but until now I tried to use as much as possible existing stuff, we already bundle way too much stuff from debian point of view  
16:48 <msmeria> hmm  
16:49 <msmeria> actually I hacked the url and this works: https://jdbc.postgresql.org/download/postgresql-9.1-901.jdbc4.jar  
16:49 <tmortagne> msmeria: yep I was about to say you can modify the URL directly  
16:49 <msmeria> ok testing this one with xwiki 7  
16:53 <msmeria> tmortagne: https://gist.github.com/msmeria/e18e690c6722929250f7  
16:53 <tmortagne> ok so you do reproduce Slashman issue at least  
16:54 <tmortagne> msmeria: what version of potgre are you testing with ?  
16:54 <tmortagne> postgre  
16:55 <tmortagne> would be great if you could try with latest 9.1 see if it's some fixed bug and then try with 9.2  
16:55 <msmeria> tmortagne: 9.4  
16:56 <tmortagne> now I have no idea if 9.1 driver is supposed to officially work with postgre 9.4, that may simply be the issue  
16:56 <tmortagne> trying to find some compatibility table  
16:57 <tmortagne> by the way they seems to recomand using jdbc41 drivers but those are not available even in the most recent ubuntu versions  
16:59 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:01 <tmortagne> looks like postgre driver on debian are such a mess that indeed maybe the best thing here is simply to bundle it...  
17:01 <msmeria> yes, that would be cool  
17:01 <msmeria> we talked about that some time ago  
17:02 <msmeria> bundle drivers for oracle, mysql and postgresql by default  
17:02 <tmortagne> as far as I understand the best is to use the latest jdbc41 driver  
17:02 <tmortagne> msmeria: this is different here  
17:02 <tmortagne> I'm only talking about debian package  
17:02 <msmeria> ah :)  
17:02 <tmortagne> and in this specific case the postgre debian package  
17:02 <vmassol> has quit  
17:03 <tmortagne> right now it's using whatever is the standard system one  
17:03 <tmortagne> in a hope that it's the one that is supposed to work best with the standard version of the server installed  
17:03 <tmortagne> and also because it's bad practice to bundle things that you can depend on  
17:23 <msmeria> tmortagne: I've tested various mysql jdbc drivers. the first one that works with xwiki 7.0 is 5.1.4  
17:24 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:27 <tmortagne> msmeria: ok thanks a lot :)  
17:27 <msmeria> you're welcome  
17:28 <msmeria> actually I realised I'm on Java 8. should I have tested on java 7 ?  
17:28 <tmortagne> I doubt it change much  
17:28 <msmeria> phew :D  
17:30 <tmortagne> did you tested other postgre drivers ?  
17:41 <gsmeria> has quit  
17:41 <vrachieru> has quit
